pros: Focus is on the students and each other. Always thinking of ways to do better. Environment that is open to sharing ideas and trying new things. Very patient people and tons of opportunities to collaborate with other departments.
cons: Insurance and salaries could be a bit better/higher, but I'm sure everyone says that about every businesses.

pros: Flexible schedule. Small class sizes. Good service and teaching opportunities for early career academics. So much potential to be an exciting school.
cons: Low, low pay. Benefits cut at the whims of the administration and board of trustees. No funds for travel. “Professional development” means periodic talks from other campus faculty. High anxiety every year about enrollment, retention.

pros: quiet campus with space to think.
cons: poor pay, long hours, unrealistic life expectations and sacrifices, meager benefits, non-salary transparency
None worth mentioning at this time.

pros: Supportive culture, beautiful campus, academic year calendar schedule.
